column6:
So I saw these pants all over the fitness side of instagram and knew I had to try them on. Went to the store, put them on, and instantly fell in love! So in love that I bought them without thinking and then later had to return them after I got my wits about me and realized I couldn't actually afford them at that time haha. After saving up I bought them in a size 4. My measurements are 32-24-38 inches for reference and I'm 5'2, and at first I went by the size chart and tried a size 8. Way too big in the waist, so I sized down to a size 6 which was better but still a bit big and made them sag in the crotch. The size 4 is perfect! Fits my waist snug and is super comfortable on my legs too. I would recommend sizing down if you aren't sure what size to get.
I wear them for lifting, even though I know they aren't for that. Despite using them for the gym (not cardio) they stayed in perfect condition. I put off washing them because I knew they had terrible reviews online about pilling and seams falling apart.
I washed them today in a lingerie bag on delicate by itself in cold water, hung it up to dry, and lo and behold, the seems are fraying pretty badly. It's mostly on one side, and there is also a couple pills there too. Very concerning after dropping more than $100 and this is only after the first wash.
Another thing is, they show sweat despite the "sweat wicking". I usually workout in nike dri fit running pants, and they never ever show sweat. Ever. So I was shocked and embarrassed when I found out on leg day that these show sweat. Before I bought them, I talked to a lululemon online chat person and asked them specifically if they showed sweat because I didn't want that, and they said no. They said only if you are sweating excessively will it show. I was not sweating excessively at all when it showed. I called my local store about it and the manager was shocked that someone would tell me that they wouldn't show sweat, and had a bit of an attitude saying that OF COURSE they would show sweat since you're wearing spandex pants (can you hear the implied "duh"?). So keep that in mind if you want these and don't want sweat to show. I have found that wearing a full underwear and not a thong helps though.
Bottom line: There are no other pants like these that I've tried on, and trust me I've tried soo many looking for any other highwaisted workout pant and none are as comfortable as these. If you have a lot of money where $100 isn't a big deal to you, then go for it and get these. They feel amazing on. But if you're like me and think $100 is a lot of money to spend on leggings, don't buy these. I"m so sad they aren't holding up. At least lululemon does repairs, right? (although now it's clear why).

column6: I rarely leave reviews, but given the abundance of negative reviews about these pants, I wanted to give my experience. I wash them constantly, and I have not experienced any of the major issues others are citing - the only pilling I have experienced is from my nails snagging the pants - other than that, the pants are pill-free. I wash my Align pants constantly, and they look the same as when I purchased them over five months ago. I wash all my Lulu items in delicates bags on hand wash cycle in cold water, and I NEVER put them anywhere near a dryer. The pros end there. Although weightlifting doesn't cause you to sweat profusely like HIIT, I still sweat from supersets and heavy weight, and these leggings hide no sweat. The crotch area is particularly vivid in sweat marks.
Furthermeo, I'm small, and I do have a thigh gap. However, even though my legs don't rub when I walk or run, my inner thighs still pilled. The rear of the leggings pilled, and the quad area and crotch area has pilling as well. I paid for pilling by the looks of these pants... :(
I'm extremely disappointed in this legging. The price is not worth the mishaps in fabric quality. It has so much potential, but after 3 pairs of align pants.... I'm wondering if Lululemon even pays attention to our reviews at this point.

column6: These are hands down the perfect pant. They came highly recommended by the salesperson at the store. And I soon as I tried them on, I fell in love. So much so that I bought 2 pairs (a long and a crop) and came back a week later to buy a third, knowing I would be out of the country for an extended period of time. If only I had read the reviews... The fit is impeccable. The material is incredibly soft and comfortable. It shapes my body beautifully and makes me look about 10 pounds lighter and much fitter. The 3 pairs I bought soon replaced my jeans as my everyday wear and I have received innumerable complements since purchasing them. They are versatile and surprisingly elegant for sportswear. I have worn them everyday all day for the past 4 months, washing each on average once per weak on the most delicate "hand-wash" cycle, inside out, then hung to dry. Sadly, as other customers have pointed out, after a few months, they started to pile. The piling on the legs is very slight but it is considerable at the crotch, which makes me think that it is much more a question of friction than upkeep. I used a good-quality sweater shaver on the affected area, which removed the bulk of the piling so that they remain wearable. Nevertheless, despite my best efforts and care, I doubt they will last me more than a year. Suffice to say that the product is a huge disappointment. As a customer, I carefully select and invest in the clothes that I buy to make sure that I can wear them for years and reduce my waste. I have purchased numerous Lululemon products in the past that have stood the test of time: from yoga pants to tops to hoodies. I have never had a problem. And I trusted that these pants would be no different - hence my investment in 3 pairs! I can't say it's money down the drain. They are amazing while they last. But I just can't get behind a product that I have to throw out after a year or less. It weighs on my conscience and purse strings. I hope Lululemon can sort it out for future products because I'd love to find a similar pant without the same problem.

Hard to expect that from a $98 pair of pants, my cheap leggings from old navy would fair better. I have continued to wear them since they are so soft but they make me feel gross : P Wish there was a way to tweak this fabric since they really are amazing pants! Sadly, i won't be buying any more.

column6: Bought my first pair last year, and haven't bought any other pant since that I loved as much! Align ALL THE WAY! Buttery soft for indoor Sunday laundry type days, and for the days when I actually get my 3 miler in outdoors.

These are the best workout pants/lounging pants. I haven't had any of the piling issues mentioned in other reviews, and don't have an explanation for that. I can attest to the feel of these pants - it really is a "naked" feel. Other workout pants feel heavy now when compared to these, so these are the only pants I wear now when working out. I have recommended these pants to friends and they have the same consensus. These really are great.

LOVE these! Fell in love with the original Aligns, but the Align II is even better. The ankle area is still a tad too loose on me (I'm 5'4), but it's better than the originals. If I could wear these every day, I absolutely would. I haven't experienced the pilling others are complaining about. I wash mine with other Lulu gear on delicate and air dry. No issues.

Honestly I was so worried about these leggings just because I knew the reviews were pretty poor with the quality and the lulu person who checked me out warned me about pilling. However, I have had these pants for 5 months now and they still look and feel brand new. Almost no pilling anywhere and they still fit like a glove. PEOPLE DO NOT PUT THEM IN THE WASH. hand wash them. with detergent. in the sink. hang to dry. I wear these like twice a week and are still in perfect condition. they even held up better than my wonder unders which have so much pilling that i bought a month ago...
anyways, BUY THEM they are amazing but take care of them...lulu is an investment
